ISO Health Indicators Framework

    

Rationale

    

Definition
Percentage of defined population with a body mass index (BMI) of 25 kg/m2 or higher.

Associated terms

    

Preferred data sources
Population-based surveys

Other possible data sources

    

Method of measurement
Based on measured height and weight.

Method of estimation
Input data and methods are described here: NCD-RisC. 
	Worldwide trends in body-mass index, underweight, overweight, and obesity from 1975 to 2016: a pooled analysis of 2416 population-based measurement studies with 128.9 million participants. Lancet 2017. DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0140-6736(17)32129-3.
